versos: (estate) Luke 12:15 - "And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.";;;
(deceived) Genesis 3:13 - Then the LORD God said to the woman, "What is this you have done" The woman said, "The serpent deceived me, and I ate.";;;
(sword) Matthew 26:52 - "Put your sword back in its place," Jesus said to him, "for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.";;;
(well) John 4:14 - "but whoever drinks the water I give them will never thirst. Indeed, the water I give them will become in them a spring of water welling up to eternal life.";;;
(nay) Matthew 5:37 - "But let your communication be, Yea, yea; nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.";;;
(charged) 1 Thessalonians 2:11 - "As ye know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you, as a father doth his children,";;;
(soldiers) Luke 7:2 - "There a centurions servant, whom his master valued highly, was sick and about to die.";;;
(battle) Psalm 140:7 - "Sovereign Lord, my strong deliverer, you shield my head in the day of battle.";;;
(strike) Exodus 21:20 - "Anyone who strikes their male or female slave with a rod must be punished if the slave dies as a direct result,";;;
(part) "And Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God." - Matthew 16:16;;;
(enemy) "Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you" - Matthew 5:44;;;
(syria) 2 Kings 16:9 - The king of Assyria complied by attacking Damascus and capturing it. He deported its people to Kir and put Rezin to death.;;;
(chief) 2 Samuel 6:1 - "David again brought together all the able young men of Israelthirty thousand.";;;
(god) Psalm 46:10 - "Be still, and know that I am god; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.";;;

(fight) Ephesians 6:12 - "For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.";;;
(neither) "For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him." - John 3:17 NIV;;;
(small) Luke 12:32 - "Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom.";;;
(save) "For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost." - Luke 19:10;;;
